column4: how can I add soundblaster 16 support to my utuntu installation?
*ubuntu

I've searched the forums trying to find out how to install MySQL5, but there are references to alot of things that I don't understand and some suggests that I should compile it myself, are there no package for MySQL5?
there is something about it in the wiki
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MYSQL5FromSource
yes, but in the forums they suggest against doing that?
against doing it from source?
why?
because it only has default language encoding and is compiled in with static linking that breaks many stuff and so on
well then I don't know how else you'd do it unless you find a deb somewhere.
a deb is just a package that installs the software for you.
ah ok
try apt-cache search mysql-server
when you do a search for mysql-server
yes
yeah I don't believe 5 is availible.  unless through a backport for breezy but you may be able to find a deb and install that.
ok, but drapper drake isn't final? and maybe nothing for a linux newbe to install at this time?
you can try these but they are not official
http://packages.dotdeb.org/dists/sarge/mysql-5.0/
I also just found that page :) so it's safe to install debian packages with ubuntu as ubuntu is derivered from debian?
Like I said its not official and it won't be supported.  Its kinda enter at your own risk type thing.
